Subject: ct2ctml problems?  (May not be a Cantera problem, though)
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=102138884
X-Yahoo-Profile: markscha
X-eGroups-Approved-By: dggoodwin <dgoodwin@...> via web; 11 May 2005 03:13:49 -0000

Well, just when I was getting productive, I ran into a problem with 
Cantera/Python.

I had Cantera working on this XP workstation, but I was trying to 
install another Python package (gnuplot-py 1.7) when I realized that 
I still had an older version of Python installed (2.3), and this was 
interfering with the gnuplot-py package.  So, I uninstalled the 2.3 
version, removed it from my PATH, and viola---Cantera started 
complaining:  "...could not convert input file to CTML".

I uninstalled Cantera, Python, Numpy, etc., reboot, re-installed 
Python, Numpy stuff, and Cantera, and I still get the same thing.

I am using Cantera 1.5.5 and Python 2.4, etc. (the standard stuff) 
on a XP workstation.  

So, am I screwed or what?  I have tried to clean my system several 
times, and I keep getting the same behavior.  I have verified the 
file pops up in the correct TMP directory.  I have also tried 
replaciing the PYTHON_CMD and put c:\Python24 in the PATH.  I have 
left the directories to be the default values, and I have tried some 
non-defaults.

Any thoughts?

-----Mark

An example Python Traceback follows:

Traceback (most recent call last):

__init__
    self._xml_id = _cantera.xml_get_XML_File(src)
